00023 /* The ring buffer implementation gleaned from the wiring_serial library by David A. Mellis. */
00024 
00025 #include <inttypes.h>
00026 #include <math.h>
00027 #include <stdlib.h>
00028 
00029 #include "planner.h"
00030 #include "nuts_bolts.h"
00031 #include "stepper.h"
00032 #include "settings.h"
00033 #include "config.h"

00035 
00036 // The number of linear motions that can be in the plan at any give time
00037 #define BLOCK_BUFFER_SIZE 40
00038 
00039 static block_t block_buffer[BLOCK_BUFFER_SIZE];  // A ring buffer for motion instructions
00040 static volatile uint8_t block_buffer_head;       // Index of the next block to be pushed
00041 static volatile uint8_t block_buffer_tail;       // Index of the block to process now
00042 static uint8_t next_buffer_head;                 // Index of the next buffer head
00043 
00044 // Define planner variables
00045 typedef struct {
00046 /// -> 843 : 4 -> N_AXIS
00047   int32_t position[N_AXIS];        // The planner position of the tool in absolute steps. Kept separate
00048                                    // from g-code position for movements requiring multiple line motions,
00049                                    // i.e. arcs, canned cycles, and backlash compensation.
00050   double previous_unit_vec[N_AXIS];     // Unit vector of previous path line segment
00051   double previous_nominal_speed;   // Nominal speed of previous path line segment
00052 } planner_t;
00053 static planner_t pl;
00054 
00055 // Returns the index of the next block in the ring buffer
00056 // NOTE: Removed modulo (%) operator, which uses an expensive divide and multiplication.
00057 static uint8_t next_block_index(uint8_t block_index)
00058 {
00059   block_index++;
00060   if (block_index == BLOCK_BUFFER_SIZE) { block_index = 0; }
00061   return(block_index);
00062 }
00063 
00064 
00065 // Returns the index of the previous block in the ring buffer
00066 static uint8_t prev_block_index(uint8_t block_index)
00067 {
00068   if (block_index == 0) { block_index = BLOCK_BUFFER_SIZE; }
00069   block_index--;
00070   return(block_index);
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00074 // Calculates the distance (not time) it takes to accelerate from initial_rate to target_rate using the
00075 // given acceleration:
00076 static double estimate_acceleration_distance(double initial_rate, double target_rate, double acceleration)
00077 {
00078   return( (target_rate*target_rate-initial_rate*initial_rate)/(2*acceleration) );
00079 }
00080 
00081 
00082 /*                        + <- some maximum rate we don't care about
00083                          /|\
00084                         / | \
00085                        /  |  + <- final_rate
00086                       /   |  |
00087      initial_rate -> +----+--+
00088                           ^  ^
00089                           |  |
00090       intersection_distance  distance                                                                           */
00091 // This function gives you the point at which you must start braking (at the rate of -acceleration) if
00092 // you started at speed initial_rate and accelerated until this point and want to end at the final_rate after
00093 // a total travel of distance. This can be used to compute the intersection point between acceleration and
00094 // deceleration in the cases where the trapezoid has no plateau (i.e. never reaches maximum speed)
00095 static double intersection_distance(double initial_rate, double final_rate, double acceleration, double distance)
00096 {
00097   return( (2*acceleration*distance-initial_rate*initial_rate+final_rate*final_rate)/(4*acceleration) );
00098 }
00099 
00100 
00101 // Calculates the maximum allowable speed at this point when you must be able to reach target_velocity
00102 // using the acceleration within the allotted distance.
00103 // NOTE: sqrt() reimplimented here from prior version due to improved planner logic. Increases speed
00104 // in time critical computations, i.e. arcs or rapid short lines from curves. Guaranteed to not exceed
00105 // BLOCK_BUFFER_SIZE calls per planner cycle.
00106 static double max_allowable_speed(double acceleration, double target_velocity, double distance)
00107 {
00108   return( sqrt(target_velocity*target_velocity-2*acceleration*distance) );
00109 }
00110 
00111 
00112 // The kernel called by planner_recalculate() when scanning the plan from last to first entry.
00113 static void planner_reverse_pass_kernel(block_t *previous, block_t *current, block_t *next)
00114 {
00115   if (!current) { return; }  // Cannot operate on nothing.
00116 
00117   if (next) {
00118     // If entry speed is already at the maximum entry speed, no need to recheck. Block is cruising.
00119     // If not, block in state of acceleration or deceleration. Reset entry speed to maximum and
00120     // check for maximum allowable speed reductions to ensure maximum possible planned speed.
00121     if (current->entry_speed != current->max_entry_speed) {
00122 
00123       // If nominal length true, max junction speed is guaranteed to be reached. Only compute
00124       // for max allowable speed if block is decelerating and nominal length is false.
00125       if ((!current->nominal_length_flag) && (current->max_entry_speed > next->entry_speed)) {
00126         current->entry_speed = min( current->max_entry_speed,
00127           max_allowable_speed(-settings.acceleration,next->entry_speed,current->millimeters));
00128       } else {
00129         current->entry_speed = current->max_entry_speed;
00130       }
00131       current->recalculate_flag = true;
00132 
00133     }
00134   } // Skip last block. Already initialized and set for recalculation.
00135 }
00136 
00137 
00138 // planner_recalculate() needs to go over the current plan twice. Once in reverse and once forward. This
00139 // implements the reverse pass.
00140 static void planner_reverse_pass()
00141 {
00142   uint8_t block_index = block_buffer_head;
00143   block_t *block[3] = {NULL, NULL, NULL};
00144   while(block_index != block_buffer_tail) {
00145     block_index = prev_block_index( block_index );
00146     block[2]= block[1];
00147     block[1]= block[0];
00148     block[0] = &block_buffer[block_index];
00149     planner_reverse_pass_kernel(block[0], block[1], block[2]);
00150   }
00151   // Skip buffer tail/first block to prevent over-writing the initial entry speed.
00152 }
00153 
00154 
00155 // The kernel called by planner_recalculate() when scanning the plan from first to last entry.
00156 static void planner_forward_pass_kernel(block_t *previous, block_t *current, block_t *next)
00157 {
00158   if(!previous) { return; }  // Begin planning after buffer_tail
00159 
00160   // If the previous block is an acceleration block, but it is not long enough to complete the
00161   // full speed change within the block, we need to adjust the entry speed accordingly. Entry
00162   // speeds have already been reset, maximized, and reverse planned by reverse planner.
00163   // If nominal length is true, max junction speed is guaranteed to be reached. No need to recheck.
00164   if (!previous->nominal_length_flag) {
00165     if (previous->entry_speed < current->entry_speed) {
00166       double entry_speed = min( current->entry_speed,
00167         max_allowable_speed(-settings.acceleration,previous->entry_speed,previous->millimeters) );
00168 
00169       // Check for junction speed change
00170       if (current->entry_speed != entry_speed) {
00171         current->entry_speed = entry_speed;
00172         current->recalculate_flag = true;
00173       }
00174     }
00175   }
00176 }
00177 
00178 
00179 // planner_recalculate() needs to go over the current plan twice. Once in reverse and once forward. This
00180 // implements the forward pass.
00181 static void planner_forward_pass()
00182 {
00183   uint8_t block_index = block_buffer_tail;
00184   block_t *block[3] = {NULL, NULL, NULL};
00185 
00186   while(block_index != block_buffer_head) {
00187     block[0] = block[1];
00188     block[1] = block[2];
00189     block[2] = &block_buffer[block_index];
00190     planner_forward_pass_kernel(block[0],block[1],block[2]);
00191     block_index = next_block_index( block_index );
00192   }
00193   planner_forward_pass_kernel(block[1], block[2], NULL);
00194 }
00195 
00196 
00197 /*                             STEPPER RATE DEFINITION
00198                                      +--------+   <- nominal_rate
00199                                     /          \
00200     nominal_rate*entry_factor ->   +            \
00201                                    |             + <- nominal_rate*exit_factor
00202                                    +-------------+
00203                                        time -->
00204 */
00205 // Calculates trapezoid parameters so that the entry- and exit-speed is compensated by the provided factors.
00206 // The factors represent a factor of braking and must be in the range 0.0-1.0.
00207 // This converts the planner parameters to the data required by the stepper controller.
00208 // NOTE: Final rates must be computed in terms of their respective blocks.
00209 static void calculate_trapezoid_for_block(block_t *block, double entry_factor, double exit_factor)
00210 {
00211   block->initial_rate = ceil(block->nominal_rate*entry_factor); // (step/min)
00212   block->final_rate = ceil(block->nominal_rate*exit_factor); // (step/min)
00213   int32_t acceleration_per_minute = block->rate_delta*ACCELERATION_TICKS_PER_SECOND*60.0; // (step/min^2)
00214   int32_t accelerate_steps =
00215     ceil(estimate_acceleration_distance(block->initial_rate, block->nominal_rate, acceleration_per_minute));
00216   int32_t decelerate_steps =
00217     floor(estimate_acceleration_distance(block->nominal_rate, block->final_rate, -acceleration_per_minute));
00218 
00219   // Calculate the size of Plateau of Nominal Rate.
00220   int32_t plateau_steps = block->step_event_count-accelerate_steps-decelerate_steps;
00221 
00222   // Is the Plateau of Nominal Rate smaller than nothing? That means no cruising, and we will
00223   // have to use intersection_distance() to calculate when to abort acceleration and start braking
00224   // in order to reach the final_rate exactly at the end of this block.
00225   if (plateau_steps < 0) {
00226     accelerate_steps = ceil(
00227       intersection_distance(block->initial_rate, block->final_rate, acceleration_per_minute, block->step_event_count));
00228     accelerate_steps = max(accelerate_steps,0); // Check limits due to numerical round-off
00229     accelerate_steps = min(accelerate_steps,block->step_event_count);
00230     plateau_steps = 0;
00231   }
00232 
00233   block->accelerate_until = accelerate_steps;
00234   block->decelerate_after = accelerate_steps+plateau_steps;
00235 }
00236 
00237 /*                            PLANNER SPEED DEFINITION
00238                                      +--------+   <- current->nominal_speed
00239                                     /          \
00240          current->entry_speed ->   +            \
00241                                    |             + <- next->entry_speed
00242                                    +-------------+
00243                                        time -->
00244 */
00245 // Recalculates the trapezoid speed profiles for flagged blocks in the plan according to the
00246 // entry_speed for each junction and the entry_speed of the next junction. Must be called by
00247 // planner_recalculate() after updating the blocks. Any recalulate flagged junction will
00248 // compute the two adjacent trapezoids to the junction, since the junction speed corresponds
00249 // to exit speed and entry speed of one another.
00250 static void planner_recalculate_trapezoids()
00251 {
00252   uint8_t block_index = block_buffer_tail;
00253   block_t *current;
00254   block_t *next = NULL;
00255 
00256   while(block_index != block_buffer_head) {
00257     current = next;
00258     next = &block_buffer[block_index];
00259     if (current) {
00260       // Recalculate if current block entry or exit junction speed has changed.
00261       if (current->recalculate_flag || next->recalculate_flag) {
00262         // NOTE: Entry and exit factors always > 0 by all previous logic operations.
00263         calculate_trapezoid_for_block(current, current->entry_speed/current->nominal_speed,
00264           next->entry_speed/current->nominal_speed);
00265         current->recalculate_flag = false; // Reset current only to ensure next trapezoid is computed
00266       }
00267     }
00268     block_index = next_block_index( block_index );
00269   }
00270   // Last/newest block in buffer. Exit speed is set with MINIMUM_PLANNER_SPEED. Always recalculated.
00271   calculate_trapezoid_for_block(next, next->entry_speed/next->nominal_speed,
00272     MINIMUM_PLANNER_SPEED/next->nominal_speed);
00273   next->recalculate_flag = false;
00274 }
00275 
00276 // Recalculates the motion plan according to the following algorithm:
00277 //
00278 //   1. Go over every block in reverse order and calculate a junction speed reduction (i.e. block_t.entry_speed)
00279 //      so that:
00280 //     a. The junction speed is equal to or less than the maximum junction speed limit
00281 //     b. No speed reduction within one block requires faster deceleration than the one, true constant
00282 //        acceleration.
00283 //   2. Go over every block in chronological order and dial down junction speed values if
00284 //     a. The speed increase within one block would require faster acceleration than the one, true
00285 //        constant acceleration.
00286 //
00287 // When these stages are complete all blocks have an entry speed that will allow all speed changes to
00288 // be performed using only the one, true constant acceleration, and where no junction speed is greater
00289 // than the max limit. Finally it will:
00290 //
00291 //   3. Recalculate trapezoids for all blocks using the recently updated junction speeds. Block trapezoids
00292 //      with no updated junction speeds will not be recalculated and assumed ok as is.
00293 //
00294 // All planner computations are performed with doubles (float on Arduinos) to minimize numerical round-
00295 // off errors. Only when planned values are converted to stepper rate parameters, these are integers.
00296 
00297 static void planner_recalculate()
00298 {
00299   planner_reverse_pass();
00300   planner_forward_pass();
00301   planner_recalculate_trapezoids();
00302 }
00303 
00304 void plan_reset_buffer()
00305 {
00306   block_buffer_tail = block_buffer_head;
00307   next_buffer_head = next_block_index(block_buffer_head);
00308 }
00309 
00310 void plan_init()
00311 {
00312   plan_reset_buffer();
00313   memset(&pl, 0, sizeof(pl)); // Clear planner struct
00314 }
00315 /// LETARTARE 29-03-2014
00316 // inline void plan_discard_current_block()
00317 void plan_discard_current_block()
00318 /// <-
00319 {
00320   if (block_buffer_head != block_buffer_tail) {
00321     block_buffer_tail = next_block_index( block_buffer_tail );
00322   }
00323 }
00324 /// LETARTARE 29-03-2014
00325 // inline block_t *plan_get_current_block()
00326 block_t *plan_get_current_block()
00327 /// <-
00328 {
00329   if (block_buffer_head == block_buffer_tail) { return(NULL); }
00330   return(&block_buffer[block_buffer_tail]);
00331 }
00332 
00333 // Returns the availability status of the block ring buffer. True, if full.
00334 uint8_t plan_check_full_buffer()
00335 {
00336   if (block_buffer_tail == next_buffer_head) { return(true); }
00337   return(false);
00338 }
00339 
00340 // Block until all buffered steps are executed.
00341 void plan_synchronize()
00342 {
00343   while (plan_get_current_block() || sys.cycle_start) {
00344     protocol_execute_runtime();   // Check and execute run-time commands
00345     if (sys.abort) { return; } // Check for system abort
00346   }
00347 }
00348 /// 843  : x, y, and z -> x, y, z and a
00349 // Add a new linear movement to the buffer. x, y, z and a is the signed, absolute target position in
00350 // millimeters. Feed rate specifies the speed of the motion. If feed rate is inverted, the feed
00351 // rate is taken to mean "frequency" and would complete the operation in 1/feed_rate minutes.
00352 // All position data passed to the planner must be in terms of machine position to keep the planner
00353 // independent of any coordinate system changes and offsets, which are handled by the g-code parser.
00354 // NOTE: Assumes buffer is available. Buffer checks are handled at a higher level by motion_control.
00355 void plan_buffer_line(double x, double y, double z, double t, double feed_rate, uint8_t invert_feed_rate)
00356 {
00357   // Prepare to set up new block
00358   block_t *block = &block_buffer[block_buffer_head];
00359 
00360   // Calculate target position in absolute steps
00361 /// -> 843 : 4 -> N_AXIS
00362   int32_t target[N_AXIS];
00363   target[X_AXIS] = lround(x*settings.steps_per_mm[X_AXIS]);
00364   target[Y_AXIS] = lround(y*settings.steps_per_mm[Y_AXIS]);
00365   target[Z_AXIS] = lround(z*settings.steps_per_mm[Z_AXIS]);
00366 /// 844
00367 #if (AXIS_T_TYPE == LINEAR)
00368   target[T_AXIS] = lround(t*settings.steps_per_mm[T_AXIS]);
00369 #else
00370   target[T_AXIS] = lround(t*settings.steps_per_degree[T_AXIS]);
00371 #endif
00372 
00373   // Compute direction bits for this block
00374   block->direction_bits = 0;
00375   if (target[X_AXIS] < pl.position[X_AXIS]) { block->direction_bits |= (1<<X_DIRECTION_BIT); }
00376   if (target[Y_AXIS] < pl.position[Y_AXIS]) { block->direction_bits |= (1<<Y_DIRECTION_BIT); }
00377   if (target[Z_AXIS] < pl.position[Z_AXIS]) { block->direction_bits |= (1<<Z_DIRECTION_BIT); }
00378 /// 844  : axis T
00379   if (target[T_AXIS] < pl.position[T_AXIS]) { block->direction_bits |= (1<<T_DIRECTION_BIT); }
00380 
00381   // Number of steps for each axis
00382   block->steps_x = labs(target[X_AXIS]-pl.position[X_AXIS]);
00383   block->steps_y = labs(target[Y_AXIS]-pl.position[Y_AXIS]);
00384   block->steps_z = labs(target[Z_AXIS]-pl.position[Z_AXIS]);
00385 /// 844  : axis T
00386   block->steps_t = labs(target[T_AXIS]-pl.position[T_AXIS]);
00387   block->step_event_count = max(block->steps_x, max(block->steps_y, max(block->steps_z, block->steps_t)));
00388 
00389   // Bail if this is a zero-length block
00390   if (block->step_event_count == 0) { return; };
00391 
00392   // Compute path vector in terms of absolute step target and current positions
00393 /// 843 : N_AXIS  -> LIN_AXIS
00394   double delta_mm[N_AXIS];
00395   delta_mm[X_AXIS] = (target[X_AXIS]-pl.position[X_AXIS])/settings.steps_per_mm[X_AXIS];
00396   delta_mm[Y_AXIS] = (target[Y_AXIS]-pl.position[Y_AXIS])/settings.steps_per_mm[Y_AXIS];
00397   delta_mm[Z_AXIS] = (target[Z_AXIS]-pl.position[Z_AXIS])/settings.steps_per_mm[Z_AXIS];
00398 /// 844  : axis T
00399 #if (AXIS_T_TYPE == LINEAR)
00400   delta_mm[T_AXIS] = (target[T_AXIS]-pl.position[T_AXIS])/settings.steps_per_mm[T_AXIS];
00401 #else
00402   delta_mm[T_AXIS] = (target[T_AXIS]-pl.position[T_AXIS])/settings.steps_per_degree[T_AXIS];
00403 #endif
00404 
00405   block->millimeters = sqrt(delta_mm[X_AXIS]*delta_mm[X_AXIS] + delta_mm[Y_AXIS]*delta_mm[Y_AXIS] +
00406                             delta_mm[Z_AXIS]*delta_mm[Z_AXIS] + delta_mm[T_AXIS]*delta_mm[T_AXIS]);
00407 
00408   double inverse_millimeters = 1.0/block->millimeters;  // Inverse millimeters to remove multiple divides
00409 
00410   // Calculate speed in mm/minute for each axis. No divide by zero due to previous checks.
00411   // NOTE: Minimum stepper speed is limited by MINIMUM_STEPS_PER_MINUTE in stepper.c
00412   double inverse_minute;
00413   if (!invert_feed_rate) {
00414     inverse_minute = feed_rate * inverse_millimeters;
00415   } else {
00416     inverse_minute = 1.0 / feed_rate;
00417   }
00418   block->nominal_speed = block->millimeters * inverse_minute; // (mm/min) Always > 0
00419   block->nominal_rate = ceil(block->step_event_count * inverse_minute); // (step/min) Always > 0
00420 
00421   // Compute the acceleration rate for the trapezoid generator. Depending on the slope of the line
00422   // average travel per step event changes. For a line along one axis the travel per step event
00423   // is equal to the travel/step in the particular axis. For a 45 degree line the steppers of both
00424   // axes might step for every step event. Travel per step event is then sqrt(travel_x^2+travel_y^2).
00425   // To generate trapezoids with contant acceleration between blocks the rate_delta must be computed
00426   // specifically for each line to compensate for this phenomenon:
00427   // Convert universal acceleration for direction-dependent stepper rate change parameter
00428   block->rate_delta = ceil( block->step_event_count*inverse_millimeters *
00429         settings.acceleration / (60 * ACCELERATION_TICKS_PER_SECOND )); // (step/min/acceleration_tick)
00430 
00431   // Compute path unit vector
00432 /// 843 : 4 -> N_AXIS
00433   double unit_vec[N_AXIS];
00434 
00435   unit_vec[X_AXIS] = delta_mm[X_AXIS]*inverse_millimeters;
00436   unit_vec[Y_AXIS] = delta_mm[Y_AXIS]*inverse_millimeters;
00437   unit_vec[Z_AXIS] = delta_mm[Z_AXIS]*inverse_millimeters;
00438 /// 844  : axis T ???
00439   unit_vec[T_AXIS] = delta_mm[T_AXIS]*inverse_millimeters;
00440 
00441   // Compute maximum allowable entry speed at junction by centripetal acceleration approximation.
00442   // Let a circle be tangent to both previous and current path line segments, where the junction
00443   // deviation is defined as the distance from the junction to the closest edge of the circle,
00444   // colinear with the circle center. The circular segment joining the two paths represents the
00445   // path of centripetal acceleration. Solve for max velocity based on max acceleration about the
00446   // radius of the circle, defined indirectly by junction deviation. This may be also viewed as
00447   // path width or max_jerk in the previous grbl version. This approach does not actually deviate
00448   // from path, but used as a robust way to compute cornering speeds, as it takes into account the
00449   // nonlinearities of both the junction angle and junction velocity.
00450   double vmax_junction = MINIMUM_PLANNER_SPEED; // Set default max junction speed
00451 
00452   // Skip first block or when previous_nominal_speed is used as a flag for homing and offset cycles.
00453   if ((block_buffer_head != block_buffer_tail) && (pl.previous_nominal_speed > 0.0)) {
00454     // Compute cosine of angle between previous and current path. (prev_unit_vec is negative)
00455     // NOTE: Max junction velocity is computed without sin() or acos() by trig half angle identity.
00456     double cos_theta = - pl.previous_unit_vec[X_AXIS] * unit_vec[X_AXIS]
00457                        - pl.previous_unit_vec[Y_AXIS] * unit_vec[Y_AXIS]
00458                        - pl.previous_unit_vec[Z_AXIS] * unit_vec[Z_AXIS]
00459                       /// 844
00460                        - pl.previous_unit_vec[T_AXIS] * unit_vec[T_AXIS] ;
00461 
00462     // Skip and use default max junction speed for 0 degree acute junction.
00463     if (cos_theta < 0.95) {
00464       vmax_junction = min(pl.previous_nominal_speed,block->nominal_speed);
00465       // Skip and avoid divide by zero for straight junctions at 180 degrees. Limit to min() of nominal speeds.
00466       if (cos_theta > -0.95) {
00467         // Compute maximum junction velocity based on maximum acceleration and junction deviation
00468         double sin_theta_d2 = sqrt(0.5*(1.0-cos_theta)); // Trig half angle identity. Always positive.
00469         vmax_junction = min(vmax_junction,
00470           sqrt(settings.acceleration * settings.junction_deviation * sin_theta_d2/(1.0-sin_theta_d2)) );
00471       }
00472     }
00473   }
00474   block->max_entry_speed = vmax_junction;
00475 
00476   // Initialize block entry speed. Compute based on deceleration to user-defined MINIMUM_PLANNER_SPEED.
00477   double v_allowable = max_allowable_speed(-settings.acceleration,MINIMUM_PLANNER_SPEED,block->millimeters);
00478   block->entry_speed = min(vmax_junction, v_allowable);
00479 
00480   // Initialize planner efficiency flags
00481   // Set flag if block will always reach maximum junction speed regardless of entry/exit speeds.
00482   // If a block can de/ac-celerate from nominal speed to zero within the length of the block, then
00483   // the current block and next block junction speeds are guaranteed to always be at their maximum
00484   // junction speeds in deceleration and acceleration, respectively. This is due to how the current
00485   // block nominal speed limits both the current and next maximum junction speeds. Hence, in both
00486   // the reverse and forward planners, the corresponding block junction speed will always be at the
00487   // the maximum junction speed and may always be ignored for any speed reduction checks.
00488   if (block->nominal_speed <= v_allowable) { block->nominal_length_flag = true; }
00489   else { block->nominal_length_flag = false; }
00490   block->recalculate_flag = true; // Always calculate trapezoid for new block
00491 
00492   // Update previous path unit_vector and nominal speed
00493   memcpy(pl.previous_unit_vec, unit_vec, sizeof(unit_vec)); // pl.previous_unit_vec[] = unit_vec[]
00494   pl.previous_nominal_speed = block->nominal_speed;
00495 
00496   // Update buffer head and next buffer head indices
00497   block_buffer_head = next_buffer_head;
00498   next_buffer_head = next_block_index(block_buffer_head);
00499 
00500   // Update planner position
00501   memcpy(pl.position, target, sizeof(target)); // pl.position[] = target[]
00502 
00503   planner_recalculate();
00504 }
00505 
00506 // Reset the planner position vector (in steps). Called by the system abort routine.
00507 void plan_set_current_position(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t z, int32_t t)
00508 {
00509   pl.position[X_AXIS] = x;
00510   pl.position[Y_AXIS] = y;
00511   pl.position[Z_AXIS] = z;
00512   pl.position[T_AXIS] = t;
00513 }
00514 
00515 // Clear planner position vector. Called by homing routine.
00516 void plan_clear_position()
00517 {
00518 clear_vector(pl.position);
00519 }
00520 
00521 // Re-initialize buffer plan with a partially completed block, assumed to exist at the buffer tail.
00522 // Called after a steppers have come to a complete stop for a feed hold and the cycle is stopped.
00523 void plan_cycle_reinitialize(int32_t step_events_remaining)
00524 {
00525   block_t *block = &block_buffer[block_buffer_tail]; // Point to partially completed block
00526 
00527   // Only remaining millimeters and step_event_count need to be updated for planner recalculate.
00528   // Other variables (step_x, step_y, step_z, rate_delta, etc.) all need to remain the same to
00529   // ensure the original planned motion is resumed exactly.
00530   block->millimeters = (block->millimeters*step_events_remaining)/block->step_event_count;
00531   block->step_event_count = step_events_remaining;
00532 
00533   // Re-plan from a complete stop. Reset planner entry speeds and flags.
00534   block->entry_speed = 0.0;
00535   block->max_entry_speed = 0.0;
00536   block->nominal_length_flag = false;
00537   block->recalculate_flag = true;
00538   planner_recalculate();
00539 }
